content.description: Climb up the crack around the arete and straight up to top out.
content.location: Access trail on north country road across from Pheasant Run

content.description: Climb crack onto southern face to top.
content.location: Access trail on north country road across from Pheasant Run

content.description: North face of high ball.Start with a high left foot and high left hand. Work your way left using the quartz crimps. Terrible feet. Follow the arete to top out.

climbs.name: Nuclear Fission
climbs.fa: Not sure if first ascent, Nov 17 2018

content.description: Start on the thin cracks of the highball face. Make a couple moves up to nice jugs on the first large diagonal crack. You can either make a big lock off/mantle to a beautiful jug or move up to the slightly worse crack and then traverse right to the jug. From there grab the arete and top out. Route can be bouldered or top roped.
content.protection: Would suggest 2 pads and a spotter at a minimum. Be careful of the other boulder which is close to this face. For top rope there is an old bolt that looks a bit rusty and an old piton.
content.location: The flat face that goes all the way to the top of the highball.

content.description: Climb north face to top out
content.location: Access trail on north country road across from Pheasant Run

content.description:
This is a two part route. The lower part of the route is Little Horn (V3) that goes up about ten feet. This upper part of the route is Big Horn (V5) that goes up about 20 feet, and includes all of the moves of Little Horn. The Crux is definitely the transition from the end of Little Horn to the beginning of Big Horn on the slab face. View the pictures for reference, and video attached of first ascent.

https://youtu.be/KSERuzGkZCE

 ^^video of ascent
content.protection: A lot of crash pads for Big Horn. 3 or 4 probably.
content.location: South face ofthe high ball slab boulder.

content.description: Easy climb up the south side of the boulder to the very top.  Great photo opportunity
Secluded in the woods overlooking the old power plant
